content: granny´s tissue box cover by daniela herbertz the tissue box cover on the picture is crochet with schachenmayr nomotta bravo in 6 colors 4mm crochet hook it´s made for a box 12x12 5 cm but you can easily adjust the size by working less row or adding more i will tell you in the pattern where you have to do that it´s up to you how many colors you will use for this project i bet even in 1 color only it will look nice o afer working round 1 & 2 in the same color i attached a new color in every new round so i will not mention that in the pattern again i will only say attach yarn abbrevations us terms slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet fo fasten_off pattern you start at the top in the middle of the cover row 1 will build the opening where you can take out the tissues round 1 chain 18 close with slip_stitch to form a ring into this ring work ch1 *3 single_crochet chain 2 3 single_crochet chain 1 3 single_crochet chain 1* repeat from * to * 3 more times slip_stitch in 1st single_crochet to close round = 4 ch2-spaces 8 ch1-spaces from now on you will only be working into the ch2-spaces =corners and the ch1- spaces in round 2 i will write it down to make it clearer after that i will not mention it again round 2 slip_stitch 3 times you shoul be in the 1st ch2-space now into this corner work ch3 2dc ch2 3dc *ch1 3 double_crochet into ch1-space ch1 3 double_crochet into next ch1-space chain 1 in next ch2-space work 3dc ch2 3dc * repeat from * to * 2 more times ch1 3 double_crochet into next ch1-space ch1 3 double_crochet into next ch1-space chain 1 slip_stitch in top of chain 3 to close round fo = 4 ch2-spaces 12 ch1-spaces round 3 attach yarn in corner and work ch3 2dc ch2 3dc * ch1 3dc 3 times in corner work 3 double_crochet ch2 3dc * repeat from * to * 3 more times ch1 3dc 3 times slip_stitch in top of chain 3 to close round fo = 4 ch2-spaces 16 ch1-spaces round 4 attach yarn in corner and work ch3 2dc ch2 3dc * ch1 3dc 4 times in corner work 3 double_crochet ch2 3dc * repeat from * to * 3 more times ch1 3dc 4 times slip_stitch in top of chain 3 to close round fo = 4 ch2-spaces 20 ch1-spaces here is the point where you sould measure if the square you made covers your top of the box if it is to big do not work round 4 i should have told you that earlier shouldn´t i o or if its to small repeat round 4 as often as needed you only have to work 1 more group of 3 double_crochet ch1 between the corners on every row you add from round 5
